lexUnit.name: look.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an expression of a feeling or thought by such an act [of looking].

sentence.text: I began to speak , but was silenced by a stern look from the Inspector and a raising of his hand .
One look from Liz had silenced her , but the damage had been done .
` Well , I draw the line at Dawn , " Sophie said firmly , then , as she caught a reproachful look from Helen , she realised how ungenerous she sounded .
The perturbed look from Cai Guoqiang suggests all is not going to plan or time …
Early on Buttons fidgeted , earning a look of disapproval from Lord Deverill .
De Villiers refused to back down , even when fitzAlan turned a look of fury on him .
" Matthew Preston , " Jenny whispered , and seeing Sara 's look of non-comprehension added , " The man Aunt Alicia rents half Moorlake to . "
` She 's no niece o'mine , " grumbled Jack , shrugging helplessly when his daughter turned a horrified look on him .
She resumed her vague look and her dusting .
Robyn 's look left him in no doubt .
He saw her sceptical look and lifted a hand .
I did a couple of years of catalogue work -- companies that sell clothing through the mail , " she said , in answer to his puzzled look .
Those words of Idris , ` Pas possible , " and his hangdog look would not leave me alone .
He slanted her a thoughtfully challenging look .
He gave her a hard , penetrating look , a look that held a charge .
Luke gave her a cold , piercing look .
She flashed him a look before bestowing her nicest smile on Jim .
Ashley darted him a look from beneath her lashes .
He threw her an angry look over his shoulder .
The angry look on the judge 's sallow face showed that either his attendance in court that morning or Cranston 's arrival had put him in an ill humour .
He flashed an angry look around the airport .
He halted only for a second , enough to narrow his eyes and purse his lips into a look of utter disgust , as though a dog 's turd had grown legs and scurried on to his carpet .
Ruxton stared her unwaveringly in the eye , a look of apprehension rather than reprimand .
She glanced at Cynthia 's face and a look of pity crossed her own .
Helen gave him a look of fury .
He gave her a strange look , and she wondered why he had called her Sarella Vila if he 'd already forgotten about Peter .
She tweaked the pale blue hat she was wearing with a look of satisfaction and walked into the café to a table in a corner .
With a mocking smile for her look of speechless outrage , he wandered out .
She found Maisie Dougall standing in the doorway , a serious look on her ruddy face .
` My friend Lady Jane told me you were a sort of Watson to -- " She stopped abruptly as she saw the look of outrage on Auguste 's face .
